devdoc.details: Explain to a developer any extra details

addLiquidity(uint256,uint256,uint256).return: _id returns unique ID of the new liquidity object.

getActiveBetsByAddress(address,bool).return: uint256[] - list of bet ID's owned by the msg.sender

getAllAvailableLiquidity().return: uint256[] - returns all liquidty ID's where they are still valid.

getBookieLiquidity(address).return: uint256[] - list of liquidity ID's owned by the msg.sender

getInActiveBetsByAddress(address,bool).return: uint256[] - list of bet ID's owned by the msg.sender

getLiquidityById(uint256).return: returns all useful properites of the liquidity object to the GUI

isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

params._matchId: a parameter just like in doxygen (must be followed by parameter name)

placeBet(uint256,uint256).details: bookieCollateral is somewhat complex as depending on the stake, the payout has to be calculated on the fly and deducted from the pool of liquidity.

params._liquidityId: pointer to available liquidity. The msg.amount is the stake.

placeBet(uint256,uint256).return: _id - returns unique ID of the new bet object.

setContractState(bool).details: Only applies to the placeBet / addLiquidity functions

setOracleAddress(address).return: returns bool - the oracle will return true if setup properly.

setResult(uint256,uint8).details: The payout structure depends on who wins but either the pundit or bookie gets paid - 1% of profits as a fee.

params._result: - result of the match. Determines how the bet pays out.

testOracleValid().return: Returns true/false based on if the oracle is setup.

devdoc.title: A title that should describe the contract/interface

adjustOdds(uint256,uint256).notice: Allows the bookie to adjust their odds for a given liquidity object.

methods.constructor: Main constructor for the contract. Set's the owner to the sender.

contractBalance().notice: Returns the total contract balance in this contract.

getActiveBetsByAddress(address,bool).notice: used by the GUI to display current bets for active user

getAllAvailableLiquidity().notice: Returns all available liquidity that a pundit can bet on. Used by the GUI to show the user all the bets they could take.

getBetById(uint256).notice: Returns all important properties of a bet by it's ID

getBookieLiquidity(address).notice: Used by the GUI to return all bookie liquidity items for tracking purpose.

getInActiveBetsByAddress(address,bool).notice: used by the GUI to display closed bets for active user

getLiquidityById(uint256).notice: Returns all useful properites of the liquidity object to the GUI

isNotExcluded().notice: Returns true/false depending if the address is in the exclusion list or not.

matchCompleteHandlePayouts(uint256).notice: Called after a match result has been set in the Oracle by the owner. Handles all the payouts depending on the result. Also refunds any excess liquidity where bets have not been placed.

placeBet(uint256,uint256).notice: Public function allowing a pundit to place a bet leveraging existing liquidity in a market/odds.

refundLiquidity(uint256).notice: Returns unused liqudity to the bookie after a match is over or if they cancel in the GUI.

selfExclude().notice: Gambling addiction is a real problem and this option allows people to self exclude from the platform should they feel they are participating in an unhealthly way.

setContractState(bool).notice: This function is for the owner to put the contract in a paused state if there is a flaw that needs to be investigated. It will stop new money from being sent to the contract.

setOracleAddress(address).notice: Called after creation to link this contract to the appropriate Oracle that provides the matches/scores.

setResult(uint256,uint8).notice: called internally by the contract owner to set the result of a given bet.

testOracleValid().notice: Calls the validation method on the oracle to prove it is connected.

userdoc.notice: Explain to an end user what this does
